context: Teradata Corporation is a cloud analytics and data platform company focused on enterprise data warehousing and analytics. Cloud analytics platform. Competing with Snowflake, Databricks.

competitors.name: Snowflake
competitors.notes: Primary cloud-native competitor in enterprise data warehousing, offering multi-cloud platform focused on unifying data and AI-powered analytics. Direct competitor in the same data warehousing and analytics landscape

competitors.name: Databricks
competitors.notes: Top alternative and major competitive threat currently raising $10B at $62B valuation. Databricks Data Intelligence Platform is the leading Teradata Vantage alternative, risking customer acquisition during Teradata's cloud migration cycles

competitors.name: Microsoft SQL Server
competitors.notes: Major database and analytics competitor, one of the top three Teradata Vantage alternatives, leveraging Microsoft's enterprise relationships and Azure cloud infrastructure

competitors.name: Google Cloud BigQuery
competitors.notes: Cloud-native data warehouse competitor from Google, offering serverless analytics and integration with Google Cloud ecosystem

competitors.name: SAP HANA Cloud
competitors.notes: Enterprise competitor in cloud database management and in-memory analytics, with SAP being listed as one of Teradata's primary competitors alongside strong ERP market position

competitors.name: IBM
competitors.notes: Primary legacy competitor in enterprise data warehousing and analytics, competing with similar hybrid cloud approaches and enterprise customer base

competitors.name: Oracle
competitors.notes: Major enterprise database and analytics competitor, one of Teradata's primary competitors with strong presence in on-premises and cloud data warehousing

competitors.name: Starburst
competitors.notes: Emerging competitor in distributed query engines and data lake analytics, offering modern alternative to traditional data warehousing approaches
